reviewText:
Nice music and cute babies.
My grandmother liked it so me that we tracked down a  copy for her sister too.
(Very slow paced.)

If you want baby to benefit from early exposure to music, try another DVD.  I recommend Piano by Dot (ages 4 and up) or Trebellina (birth up), the latter of which teaches babies how to read music (as well as playing mozart, groove, etc).

I love the classical Mozart music.  My little ones love to watch the babies dance and play, and the music is more beneficial to them than the usual "kid tunes".
A refreshing change.
